news.title: London developers are snapping up empty airspace above rooftops
news.para: This trend, already established in cities like New York, presents economic advantages for developers but faces local opposition.

news.title: Gurugram properties registered despite prohibition; revenue officials under scanner
news.para: Revenue officials in Gurugram are under scrutiny for allegedly ignoring directives from the Town and Country Planning Department. Reports indicate that property registrations, including those of the Bristol Hotel-cum-commercial complex on MG Road, were processed despite explicit order prohibitions.

news.title: WeWork India to add 3,300 desks in Hyderabad; plans ₹100 crore investment
news.para: WeWork India will add 2,50,348 sq ft of space, in Hyderabad creating approximately 3,300 new desks. This expansion is expected to be operational by June 2026. The investment for this growth is around ₹100 crore.

news.title: Arisinfra Solutions posts net profit of ₹18.26 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Arisinfra Solutions announced strong financial results for the quarter ending December 31, 2025. Net profit surged to ₹18.26 crore from ₹2.04 crore last year. Total income rose by 46.83 percent to ₹272.48 crore. The company is also exploring the asphalt market through a partnership with JS Infra Solutions.

news.title: Aadhar Housing Finance's net profit rises 17.49% in Q3 FY26
news.para: Aadhar Housing Finance's net profit saw an increase of 17.49 percent for the quarter ending December 31, 2025. Total income also rose by 18.32 percent. Assets under management reached ₹28,790 crore, showing a 20 percent year-on-year growth.

news.title: Nila Spaces' net profit up 118.45% in Q3 FY26
news.para: Nila Spaces announced a 118.45 percent jump in its net consolidated profit for the quarter ending December 31, 2025. The company's profit after tax reached ₹8.17 crore. Total income also saw a rise of 58.28 percent. The company also acquired AIt DRX India, a digital real estate marketplace, for ₹6.03 crore.

news.title: Ambuja Cements' net profit falls 86.22% in Q3 FY26
news.para: Ambuja Cements, a subsidiary of the Adani Group, reported a staggering 86.22% decline in net profit for Q4 2025. While total income reflected a slight decrease, the company is diligently working on reducing costs, focusing on enhancing power and fuel efficiency.

news.title: Brigade Enterprises' net profit dips 12.61% in Q3 FY26
news.para: Brigade Enterprises saw its net profit drop by 12.61 percent in the quarter ending December 31, 2025. The company recorded net bookings of 1.33 million square feet in its real estate segment. A new land parcel was acquired in Secunderabad for a residential project.

news.title: Housing department gets nod to implement Uttar Pradesh redevelopment plan
news.para: The Uttar Pradesh government has approved a redevelopment policy to unlock prime urban land parcels. This policy will guide housing development authorities in processing private player applications for building redevelopment, addressing underutilization due to disputes, poverty, and degeneration. The government also plans to revise development fees to promote urbanisation and affordability.

news.title: Aadhaar authentication a must for property registrations in Belagavi now
news.para: Belagavi DC Mohammad Roshan has mandated Aadhaar authentication for all property registrations to combat a large-scale racket involving duplicate Aadhaar numbers used for fraudulent transactions. This directive follows a report exposing impersonation and illegal property transfers, prompting the formation of a joint task force to investigate the misuse of identity documents.

news.title: Villagers protest against construction of resorts, luxury villas in Bittangala
news.para: Villagers in Bittangala, Virajpet, are protesting a resort and luxury villa project, deeming it illegal and a threat to their landslide-prone community. Environmentalists and activists claim authorities granted permissions in violation of rules and a high court order. They warn of potential destruction and urge local MLAs to intervene.

news.title: Godrej Properties acquires 8.5-acre land parcel in Mahalunge, Pune
news.para: Godrej Properties has acquired an 8.5-acre site in Mahalunge, Pune, where they have plans to build a residential community. This project is projected to rake in around ₹2,000 crore.

news.title: Ghaziabad: GDA set to hand over five colonies, pay ₹66 crore for pending civic work to GMC
news.para: Ghaziabad Development Authority (GDA) and Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation (GMC) have formalized the handover of five colonies, with GDA allocating Rs 66 crore for infrastructure upgrades. This marks the first seamless handover agreement since Indirapuram, addressing long-pending development works in areas like Swarn Jyantipuram and Pratap Vihar.

news.title: From Feb 1, property registration in Uttar Pradesh through Aadhaar-based authentication
news.para: Uttar Pradesh's state cabinet has approved an Aadhaar-based authentication system for property registrations, set to be implemented from February 1. This move aims to curb land scams by verifying identities electronically through e-KYC, biometrics, and e-signatures. Additionally, a project to digitize old property documents from 2002-2017 has been extended by six months.

news.title: Chhattisgarh’s Dhamtari becomes first district in country to collect property tax via SAMARTH portal
news.para: Dhamtari district has become the first in India to launch online tax collection for its gram panchayats via the SAMARTH Panchayat portal. This digital initiative, successfully piloted in Sankara gram panchayat, allows rural residents to pay property taxes from home using UPI, aiming to simplify administration and boost self-reliance.

news.title: Over 6,000 affordable homes in Gurugram, 4,728 applicants shortlisted in first phase, verification on
news.para: Gurugram has received over 1.2 lakh applications for 6,743 affordable EWS houses priced at Rs 1.5 lakh each. The booking process is underway for 1-BHK flats, with a transparent verification and draw system in place. Eligible applicants are urged to deposit the booking amount promptly to secure housing benefits.

news.title: Apple expands Hyderabad office footprint to 6.3 lakh sq ft at Xander’s WaveRock Campus
news.para: Apple India has expanded its presence at Hyderabad's WaveRock IT campus, leasing an additional 65,168 square feet. This brings the tech giant's total footprint at the Xander-owned property to nearly 6.3 lakh square feet, solidifying its position as a major tenant. The new lease, for a five-year term, underscores Hyderabad's growing importance as a hub for global capability centers.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh draws up note on metropolitan corporation for Noida after SC order
news.para: The UP industries department has prepared a note for the state council of ministers on creating a metropolitan corporation in Noida, a move requiring legislative changes. This proposal stems from a Supreme Court order following a Special Investigation Team's report that criticized Noida Authority's functioning and recommended a more transparent, citizen-centric governance model.

news.title: SC stays Orissa high court order on legality of CC issued to Pahala project
news.para: The Supreme Court has stayed an Orissa High Court ruling that excluded a major real estate project from RERA. The High Court had deemed the project completed in 2015, prior to RERA's implementation. However, the apex court's intervention revives uncertainty, questioning if completion certificates alone suffice without occupancy and safety clearances.

news.title: Haryana revenue department seeks pending PAN details in high-value property registrations
news.para: In a bid to streamline property transactions, Haryana officials are urging all individuals engaged in deals exceeding 30 lakh rupees to promptly provide their Permanent Account Number (PAN) details. This directive targets deals spanning from the fiscal years 2019-20 through 2024-25.
